metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1018 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in Adobe Flash Player before 18.0.0.343 and19.x through 21.x before 21.0.0.213 on Windows and OS X and before11.2.202.616 on Linux allows attackers to execute arbitrary code viacrafted JPEG-XR data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1018` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

flashplugin-downloader - 11.2.202.616ubuntu0.14.04.1
flashplugin-installer - 11.2.202.616ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: flashplugin-nonfree package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '11.2.202.616ubuntu0.14.04.1').
